issue.title: bitcoind.exe keeps crashing (0.10.0rc1 and 0.9.3)
issue.body:
I'm having a serious and persistant problem with bitcoin core and Armory.

I experienced a Blue Screen of Death (memory_management x1A) while Armory was running. It was probably still building it's database. After that I started having problems trying to get Armory to run to the point where I could see my balances. 

Bitcoind.exe kept dying with the message "bitcoind.exe has stopped working". I was running bitcoin-0.10.0rc1-win64-setup at that point.

I tried lots of things but bitcoind kept dying so I finally decided to make a completely clean start. I uninstalled Armory and bitcoin core and deleted all of their files (including the blockchain) except my wallets.

I downloaded the bootstrap file, verified it's SHA256 hash and put it in my bitcoin directory. I then installed bitcoin 0.9.3 and Armory 0.92.3 and fired up Armory. It ran for about an hour before I noticed I still had the problem - bitcoind.exe had died AGAIN. 

I'm at a loss here - I started from scratch and still have the damn problem!

If anyone can tell me where to go for help, I would sure appreciate it.

Here is my armorylog.txt file:

events.body:
Never mind, I have a hardware problem, as indicated by the BSOD I got. 
I ran Memtest86 overnight and had hundreds of errors.
Sorry to have bothered you.
